cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with secret sharing schemes, which are typically studied in the areas of information theory (cs.IT), cryptography (cs.CR), and coding theory (cs.CC). The use of algebraic geometry codes is a specific technique within coding theory, which makes cs.CC a likely category. The paper also discusses the security properties of the schemes, which could fall under the sub-categories of distributed systems (cs.DS) or security and privacy (cs.SI).
